00033  * @todo Document this.

00035 void tmcl_init(TMCLDevice *device) {
00036 
00037     int i;
00038     DEBUG("tmcl_init()\n");
00039     for(i = 1; i <= TMCL_MAX_PAR_NO; i++) {
00040         device->parameter[i] = 0;
00041     }
00042 
00043 }

00054 /**
00055  * 
00056  * @param commands Buffer containing the datagram
00057  * @param length length of datagram
00058  * @return Checksum
00059  * @see #TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_CAN, #TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX, #TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_IIC
00060  */
00061 uint8_t tmcl_checksum(uint8_t *commands, int length) {
00062 
00063     uint8_t checksum = 0;
00064     int i;
00065 
00066     for(i=0; i < length; i++) {
00067         checksum += ((*commands++) & 0xFF);
00068     }
00069 
00070     return checksum;
00071 }
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * @param datagram  Buffer to store the datagram
00075  * @param device        The device for which the datagram is intended
00076  * @param command   The @ref TMCLComm "command" 
00077  * @param type           Type
00078  * @param value         Value
00079  * @return Length of datagram
00080  * @see @ref TMCLComm "TMCL Commands"
00081  */
00082 int tmcl_datagram(uint8_t *datagram,
00083                   TMCLDevice device, uint8_t command, uint8_t type, uint32_t value) {
00084 
00085     int pos = 0; /* Current position in datagram */
00086     int dgram_length = 0; /* Length of Datagram; */
00087 
00088     int i;
00089 
00090     switch(device.bus) {
00091     case TMCL_RSXXX:
00092         dgram_length = TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX;
00093         break;
00094     case TMCL_CAN:
00095         dgram_length = TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_CAN;
00096         break;
00097     case TMCL_IIC:
00098         dgram_length = TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_IIC;
00099         break;
00100     case TMCL_NONE:
00101     default:
00102         return -1; /* Invalid bus */
00103     }
00104     
00105     /* Clear datagram */
00106     for(i=0; i < dgram_length; i++) {
00107         datagram[i] = 0;
00108     }
00109 
00110     if(device.bus == TMCL_RSXXX) { /* address is only needed for RS232/RS485 */
00111         datagram[pos++] = device.address;
00112     }
00113 
00114     datagram[pos++] = command;
00115     datagram[pos++] = type;
00116     datagram[pos++] = device.bank;
00117     datagram[pos++] = (value >> 24) & 0xFF;
00118     datagram[pos++] = (value >> 16) & 0xFF;
00119     datagram[pos++] = (value >>  8) & 0xFF;
00120     datagram[pos++] = value & 0xFF;
00121 
00122     if(device.bus != TMCL_CAN) {        /* CAN bus needs no checksum */
00123         datagram[pos] = tmcl_checksum(datagram, pos);
00124         pos++;
00125     }
00126 
00127     assert(dgram_length == pos); /* Just to be sure.. */
00128 
00129     return dgram_length;
00130 }
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * @param reply The @ref tmcl_reply "reply" of the module
00134  * @return 
00135  *               - 1 on good checksum
00136  *               - 0 on bad checksum 
00137  */
00138 int tmcl_valid_checksum(TMCLReply reply) {
00139 
00140     uint8_t datagram[8];
00141 
00142     if(reply.reply_address == 0) { /* Reply address is 0 for CAN Bus which has no checksum */
00143         return 2;
00144     }
00145 
00146     datagram[0] = reply.reply_address;
00147     datagram[1] = reply.module_address;
00148     datagram[2] = reply.status;
00149     datagram[3] = reply.command;
00150     datagram[4] = (reply.value >> 24) & 0xFF;
00151     datagram[5] = (reply.value >> 16) & 0xFF;
00152     datagram[6] = (reply.value >>  8) & 0xFF;
00153     datagram[7] = reply.value & 0xFF;
00154 
00155     if(reply.checksum == tmcl_checksum(datagram, 8)) {
00156         return 1;
00157     } else {
00158         return 0;
00159     }
00160 
00161 }
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * 
00165  * @param reply @ref tmcl_reply structure to store the data
00166  * @param datagram The datagram received from the module
00167  * @param length Lengh of the datagram
00168  * @return 
00169  *               -  0 on success
00170  *               - -1 undefined length
00171  */
00172 int tmcl_dgram2reply(TMCLReply *reply, uint8_t *datagram, int length) {
00173 
00174     int pos = 0; /* Current position in datagram */
00175     DEBUG("tmcl_dgram2reply(), length=%d\n", length);
00176     DEBUG("dgram2reply datagram 0x%02X,%02X,%02X,%02X,%02X,%02X,%02X,%02X,%02X of length %d\n",\
00177               datagram[0], datagram[1], datagram[2], datagram[3], datagram[4], datagram[5],\
00178               datagram[6], datagram[7], datagram[8], length);
00179     switch(length) {
00180     case TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX:
00181         reply->reply_address = datagram[pos++];
00182         reply->checksum          = datagram[TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_RSXXX-1] ;
00183         break;
00184     case TMCL_DGRAM_SIZE_CAN:
00185         reply->reply_address    = 0;
00186         reply->checksum                 = 0;
00187         break;
00188     default: /* Undefined length */
00189         return -1;
00190     }
00191 
00192     reply->module_address       = datagram[pos++];
00193     reply->status                       = datagram[pos++];
00194     reply->command                      = datagram[pos++];
00195     reply->value         = (( datagram[pos++] & 0xFF ) << 24);
00196     reply->value     |= (( datagram[pos++] & 0xFF ) << 16);
00197     reply->value     |= (( datagram[pos++] & 0xFF ) << 8);
00198     reply->value     |= (( datagram[pos++] & 0xFF ) );
00199 
00200     DEBUG("module address: %d\n", reply->module_address);
00201     DEBUG("status: %d\n", reply->status);
00202     DEBUG("command: %d\n", reply->command);
00203     DEBUG("value: %d\n", reply->value);
00204     DEBUG("tmcl_dgram2reply() END\n");
00205 
00206     /* TODO: Insert proper assert() */
00207     return 0;
00208 }
